title: Online Media and Bloggers
content:
Module 2, Lesson 8: Online Media and Bloggers

The Hook

Digital influencers and online journalists now rival traditional media in reach. Building relationships with them requires understanding their platform and audience.

In this lesson, we explore how Online Media and Bloggers fits into the broader discipline of Media Relations and equip you with practical tools for immediate application.

The Concept

1. Strategic Context

Every PR activity exists within a strategic context. For Online Media and Bloggers, this means understanding the organisation's overall communications objectives and how this area contributes to them. Without strategic alignment, tactical activities lack direction and measurable value.

2. Core Principles

The core principles governing Online Media and Bloggers draw from decades of professional practice and academic research. These principles — transparency, consistency, audience-centricity, and evidence-based decision-making — provide a reliable foundation regardless of context.

3. Tools and Techniques

Practitioners in Media Relations use a range of tools: stakeholder mapping matrices, message development frameworks, channel selection models, and measurement dashboards. Understanding which tool to deploy — and when — is a hallmark of professional expertise.

4. Common Challenges

Challenges in Online Media and Bloggers typically include: aligning multiple stakeholders, adapting messages across different audiences, navigating time pressure, and demonstrating measurable impact. Anticipating these challenges and building contingency plans distinguishes excellent practitioners.

5. Professional Standards

The CIPR, PRCA, and PRSA provide ethical codes and professional standards that govern all PR practice including Online Media and Bloggers. Adhering to these standards protects practitioners, clients, and the credibility of the profession as a whole.

The Illustration

You have completed Online Media and Bloggers within the Media Relations module. The key takeaways are: the strategic importance of this area; the core principles that guide best practice; the practical tools and techniques available; the common challenges and how to overcome them; and the professional standards that must be upheld. Continue to the next lesson to build on these foundations.
